Lee Edwards (born 1932) is an American conservative political writer and historian. He was born in Chicago. He thought at the B. Kenneth Simon Center for American Studies at The Heritage Foundation. He was a historian of the conservative movement in America and of the Presidency of Ronald Reagan.
Edwards is the author or editor of 25 books, and wrote about biographies of President Ronald Reagan, Senator Barry Goldwater, Attorney General Edwin Meese III and William F. Buckley, Jr.. He is currently the Chairman of the Victims of Communism Memorial Foundation.
